full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 64 of 262 1769
LC8Cmax3 Hesse - direct
1 Q. What kind of work do you do now?
2 A. I am a CNA. I work with the elderly. I'm also a teacher
3 and work with young children.
4 Q. Where did you work in approximately 2003?
5 A. I worked at the Epstein home.
6 Q. At what home are you referring to?
7 A. Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell's house.
8 Q. Where was that house located?
9 A. On Palm Beach, El Brillo Way.
10 Q. What were your job responsibilities when you worked at the Epstein and Maxwell home?
11 A. To take care of the home when they weren't there, any maintenance. Things like that.
12 Q. So, to clear, were they home when you were working in the house?
13 A. No.
14 Q. Who hired you?
15 A. Ghislaine Maxwell.
16 Q. What did Maxwell look like when you first met her?
17 A. Short brown hair, defined cheeks, well put together, pretty.
18 MS. MOE: Your Honor, may we publish what's in evidence as Government Exhibit 115 as a public exhibit?
19 THE COURT: You may.
20 MS. MOE: Thank you, your Honor.
21 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00013342

1 Q. What kind of work do you do now?
2 A. I am a CNA. I work with the elderly. I'm also a teacher
3 and work with young children.
4 Q. Where did you work in approximately 2003?
5 A. I worked at the Epstein home.
6 Q. At what home are you referring to?
7 A. Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell's house.
8 Q. Where was that house located?
9 A. On Palm Beach, El Brillo Way.
10 Q. What were your job responsibilities when you worked at the Epstein and Maxwell home?
11 A. To take care of the home when they weren't there, any maintenance. Things like that.
12 Q. So, to clear, were they home when you were working in the house?
13 A. No.
14 Q. Who hired you?
15 A. Ghislaine Maxwell.
16 Q. What did Maxwell look like when you first met her?
17 A. Short brown hair, defined cheeks, well put together, pretty.

MS. MOE: Your Honor, may we publish what's in evidence as Government Exhibit 115 as a public exhibit?
THE COURT: You may.
MS. MOE: Thank you, your Honor.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with clear and legible text. There are no visible redactions or damage.
